name: Quick Beef Stroganoff with Egg Noodles and Garlic Ciabatta
description: A fast, family-friendly skillet stroganoff with tender beef, mushrooms, and creamy sauce over egg noodles, plus warm garlic ciabatta on the side.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F) for the garlic butter ciabatta.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil for the egg noodles.
Slice beef sirloin steak thinly against the grain.
Slice mushrooms and onions; mince garlic.
cook_steps: Place garlic butter ciabatta on a tray and bake until hot and crisp, 8–10 minutes; keep warm.
Cook egg noodles in boiling salted water until tender, 6–8 minutes; drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season beef lightly with salt and pepper, then sear in two batches until just browned, 2–3 minutes per batch. Transfer to a plate.
Reduce heat to medium. Add a small knob of butter to the skillet, then sauté onions and mushrooms with a pinch of salt until softened and lightly browned, 4–5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Pour in stroganoff sauce and bring to a gentle simmer, 1–2 minutes. Return beef and any juices to the pan and toss to coat; simmer 1 minute to warm through. Adjust salt and pepper to taste.
Toss drained egg noodles with a little butter, then plate and spoon stroganoff over the noodles. Garnish with parsley if using. Serve with warm garlic butter ciabatta.

Toss drained egg noodles with a little butter, then plate and spoon stroganoff over the noodles. Garnish with parsley if using. Serve with warm garlic butter ciabatta.
